page.title: 03THE RAILWAY
page.content: The railway, now operated by British Rail, runs through the area at two different levels. The{upper line, running through a deep cutting, was built first by a private railway company to provide a link between London and Derby. The lower line with the{tunnel}was built later to provide an easier gradient for the trains. The construction of the tunnel, one of the longest in existence at the time, resulted in the deaths of three workers. One of them, John Jones, fell down number five shaft and was found to be dead when brought to the surface. Some of the railwaymen are buried in Souldrop churchyard and one of the graves is marked with an iron cross. It may be the ghost of one of these workers that haunts the house in Souldrop High Street.
